column4: If I pop open a Terminal, and run a file or programs or something, it has to stay open till I either force quit the application along with the Terminal, or I close the app. How do I open it without requiring Terminal the whole time too? For example, << gksudo nautilus >>
go to the terminal, hit CTRL+Z, then type "bg", then you can exit the terminal
or when you run a program, run it with & at the end
err... "bg 1"
otherwise the program woiuld probably be frozen
No, no, no, I mean I run let's say << gksudo nautilus >>. I go to the Terminal, hit CTRL+Z, and it runs fine
well thats cause nautilus is always running :)
Ah. Good point.
He has no control over that
Not that I'm aware?
what am i looking at?
Nautilus "Home" folder
yes... but whats wrong about it
The colors are all wrong. I'm using the stock Ambiance theme.
switch back to it anyway?
nightshade209, http://imagebin.org/192084
have you tried switching it to something else, then back to ambiance?
try installing gnome-tweak-tool and playing with the theming in there
Umm.... That's what half the screenshot was of..
so it is...
nightshade209, I ran software updates and it fixed it. What broke it was an update from 2 hours ago
